fields.description:
The user is unable to create an issue after an issue type has been deleted. The Issue Type screens shows all the issue types as not being associated with an issue type scheme, however the issue type schemes are still present. 

*Steps to reproduce:*
* Delete an issue type
* GET A 500 ERROR (not reproducible every time)
* Click delete on the issue type that was being deleted
* Get the below error with only a cancel button

*Expected behavior*
When clicking on the Create button, issue type drop down should be visible.
The default issue type scheme should not have double up issue types.
The issue types should all show as being associated with an issue type scheme.
Deleting an issue type should have a delete and cancel button present.

*Actual behavior*
(creating an issue) There is only a project drop down
(viewing issue type scheme) The default issue type scheme is showing two of most issue types (e.g. "Issue", and then "Issue" again)
(viewing issue types) All issue types are showing as not having any associated issue type scheme
(deleting an issue type) There is only a cancel link displayed.

{panel:title=*Confirmation dialogue:*}

!confirmation_screen.png!
{panel}

*Workaround:*
* Open the Default Issue Type Scheme
* Click the Save button
* Everything returns to normal
fields.summary: Issue Types all showing as not being associated with a Scheme after deleting an Issue Type

fields.description:
Custom fields have an associated property set that can hold additional information such as translated custom field names.  The method used to load the property set is a general purpose one and uses an inefficient means of creating the property set.  With a large number of custom fields, this causes a small performance penalty.

The impact is not expected to be significant for most instances.
fields.summary: Performance hot spot loading property set data for custom fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43553].
  {panel}

When using the Issue Picker type-ahead, it will repeat the user's last JQL search several times as the user types an issue.

So if the user ran a slow search such as any using "WAS", it creates some pressures on the system. Ideally, WAS/WAS IN performance should be addressed, but this behavior doesn't help:

{code}
11 "GET /rest/api/1.0/issues/picker?currentJQL=...
11 "GET /rest/api/1.0/issues/picker?currentJQL=...
11 "GET /rest/api/1.0/issues/picker?currentJQL=...
11 "GET /rest/api/1.0/issues/picker?currentJQL=...
11 "GET /rest/api/1.0/issues/picker?currentJQL=...
11 "GET /rest/api/1.0/issues/picker?currentJQL=...
{code}

h3. Reproduction

1. Run a slow JQL search
2. Open an issue
3. Open the Link operation, and start typing an issue key
4. JQL searches are fired in the background
fields.summary: Issue Picker in Link Issue Operation repeats last JQL search multiple times

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43552].
  {panel}

As an Atlassian stack administrator I want to be able to manage a collection of data in only one location.

Projects in FishEye and Crucible can be customized with repositories (either whole repos and/or specific paths) so that the user UI (Projects page) reflects activity from only the referenced locations. Add a feature to the Activity Stream to display activity from repositories/ repository paths attached to Projects. 

This functionality is dependent on FishEye being licensed:
(/) FishEye
(/) FishEye + Crucible
(-) Crucible

h4. Current experience

# Add repository (whole or path) to a Project in FishEye/Crucible.
# Add individual repositories as Entity links in JIRA.
# Add Projects as Entity links in JIRA (if applicable). 

h4. Desired experience

# Add Projects as Entity links in JIRA.
fields.summary: Stream repository data from FishEye/Crucible Projects in Activity Stream gadget
Ability to change the Text Formatting Notation

fields.description:
h4. Current behavior -- this is just one example. This also applied if only Crucible is licensed.

# Install JIRA.
# Install FishEye/Crucible but only license FishEye.
# Create an Application Link from JIRA to FishEye.
# Navigate to JIRA Dashboard and edit the Activity Stream gadget.
# Note the option to include the Crucible stream is also available:!2015-05-27_1647.png|thumbnail!

The same experience occurs when only Crucible is licensed.

h4. Expected behavior

# Only the licensed product, FishEye, should appear on the "Activity Stream > Edit" screen.
fields.summary: Activity Stream gadget displays both FishEye + Crucible products as stream options regardless of license

fields.description:
The Development Panel presents a list of commits related to the JIRA issue which were committed to a repository in FishEye/Crucible. The commit number is clickable, redirecting the user to that commit in FishEye, but if FishEye is not enabled (i.e. there's no FishEye license, only a Crucible license) the URL formed is {{JIRA URL/browse/undefined}}, leading the user to an error page which doesn't leave it clear why it couldn't open the commit.

The screenshots below show this:
# Opening the Dev Panel we have a list of commits. Hovering the commit number shows the URL:
!dev1.png|thumbnail!
# Clicking on the link leads to the following page in JIRA:
!dev2.png|thumbnail!

No error is thrown in the logs.

h4.Fix
This is already fixed since JIRA 6.4 in which, if FishEye is disabled, the commit number won't be shown as a link.
Refer to the [JIRA Upgrade Guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA] for instructions on how to upgrade JIRA.
fields.summary: Commit in Development Panel leads to error page if FishEye is not enabled
Add Threaded Comments as a feature
Return start date from fix versions API

fields.description: I have created a plugin that adds several version tab panels and cannot find them when using the "new project navigation". Disabling the new project navigation allows me to see the version tab panels again.
fields.summary: Version Tab Panels Do Not Appear When Using Release Hub

fields.description:
Hello,

I'm using FishEye 3.8.0 and JIRA 6.4.5.  I have gravatar enabled on all ends of my Atlassian products (download not cloud).  I notice the activity streams do not show gravatar on FisheEye Git commits.

Thank you.
fields.summary: FishEye Commits not showing Gravatar in Activity Stream

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After Upgrading to JIRA 6.4.x , it is no possible to open PDF attachment in a new window

PDF attachment can be viewed in a new window without downloading the attachment in JIRA version 6.3.12

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Google Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce
#  Create Issue > Attach .pdf file
#  View Create Issue > Right-click and open the .pdf file in a new window 

h3. Expected Results
# Should be able to view the .pdf file in a new window without downloading the file as it behaves in JIRA 6.3.12
!6312-1.png|thumbnail!
!6312-2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
# the .pdf file refuse to be opened in the new window. It automatically downloads the .pdf file.
!644-1.png|thumbnail!
!644-2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
- None
fields.summary: Unable to open PDF attachment in browser window from JIRA Issue View
Allow Other Fields to be clickable in issue navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43539].
  {panel}

When you change the JIRA instance Default language from the default English to Czech (but tested also for German, for example) and you create a new project afterwards, the are new, and seemingly unwanted, Issue Types and Resolutions generated - duplicating the existing ones. See the attached screenshots for an illustration.

One can imagine all the drawbacks connected with this. One of the problems is that the newly generated Issue Types lack translations -> so you must (re)translate them to English and so on if needed.

Tested on JIRA 6.4.4, with just the Agile add-on installed.

The simplest way of how to work-around this issue (or an undocumented feature?) is NOT to switch from the default English language, which is also the best usage scenario in the most cases... :)

h3. Summary
Editing the Issue Description in the detail view may hide the JIRA navigation bar (top menu), depending on the screen resolution

h3. Environment
- Reproducible on the browsers below:
-* Google Chrome 43.0.2357.81 (64-bit)
-* Firefox 38.0.1
- This problem does not happen on Safari
- This issue also depends on the screen resolution: 
-- I have replicated it using a MacBook Pro (1280 x 800 display) with the browser window in full screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Tested on a clean JIRA 6.4.5 instance.
# Created a DEMO project.
# Go to the Issue Navigator.
# Ensure you are on "Detail View".
# Find an issue with a long description.
# Edit the description field.
# The window will scroll to fit the whole description textbox in the screen.
# Leave the inline edit for the description field.
# It seems the scrolling gets locked on the issue frame.

h3. Expected Results
It should be possible to view the JIRA top menu bar by scrolling up.

h3. Actual Results
After leaving the inline edit for the description field, it is not possible to scroll up to see the JIRA top menu bar anymore.

h3.Workaround
Refreshing the page or switching to "List View" displays the top menu again.
fields.summary: Editing the Issue Description in the detail view may hide the JIRA navigation bar

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a mail server is using AES_256 ciphers, JIRA is unable to connect to it with the following error
{code}Unfortunately no connection was possible. Review the errors below and rectify:
EOFException: SSL peer shut down incorrectly{code}

OpenSSL is able to connect to the Mail Server from the JIRA host server using JIRA credentials, but JIRA itself isn't able to.

Using SSL dump, the main difference is that for the working connection (using OpenSSL), AES_128 & AES_256 ciphers are offered, with TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA being accepted. For the JIRA initiated IMAPS connection, only AES_128 ciphers are offered, which the mailserver rejects straight away.

The following are SSL dump extraces from JIRA and OpenSSL
* [^JIRA.txt]
* [^OpenSSL.txt]
fields.summary: Support integration with applications using AES_256 encryption

fields.description:
It seems that JIRA recently complains about collation, which it would be a good thing unless it would complain about a valid collation being as incorrect.

We are using a database with UTF-8 encoding and C.UTF-8 collation, which is it the correct collation to use for an UTF-8 database.

{code}
****************************************************************************************************
You are using an unsupported postgres72 collation: C.UTF-8. This may cause some functionality to not work.
Please use C or POSIX as the collation instead.
****************************************************************************************************
{code}

Having a database with encoding "C" would be Unicode compatible and will clearly crease serious issues when dealing with text data. 

It seems that you must consider C.UTF-8 and POSIX.UTF-8 as valid encodings. In fact this warning message should include a link to a Confluence page that documents the correct database encodings to use.
fields.summary: incorrect warning about use of C.UTF-8 collation

fields.description:
I was performing a manual upgrade following instructions from the following page:
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA064/Upgrading+JIRA+Manually#UpgradingJIRAManually-3.SettingupyournewJIRAinstallation ]

There were a few sections which were a little unclear and perhaps could be reworded or updated.

Section 2.3 -
{quote}3. Navigate to the directory specified in the configuration file and create a backup of it in another directory.
4. (error) Delete the file <jira-home>/dbconfig.xml as soon as the backup is complete.{quote}

It's unclear whether the file has to be deleted from the back up or the original folder.  This makes a difference when performing Step 3.2.  It should be clearer that it the file should be removed from the original folder.

{quote}3.2 Point your new JIRA to (a copy of) your existing JIRA Home directory
If your new JIRA 6.4 installation is on a new server, copy the backup of your existing JIRA Home Directory from the old server to the new server before proceeding.{quote}

The user needs to be instructed to keep a backup of the folder and if they are moving to a new server to use a copy of the original folder (which should be minus the dbconfig file).

{quote}3.6 Import your old JIRA data into your new JIRA
After you have started your new JIRA installation, import the data from your old instance into the new instance. You will need the backup file of data from your old JIRA that you created earlier in these instructions (above).

To import your old JIRA data into your new JIRA:

Log in as a user with the 'JIRA System Administrators' global permission.{quote}
After JIRA has been restarted, the user will be directed to the startup wizard - which asks users to set up a new jira instance, or back up from XML.  In order to follow the rest of the instructions the user needs to set up a clean version of JIRA.  This should be mentioned after {quote}After you have started your new JIRA installation,{quote}, to save confusion, or the customer importing the XML twice.
fields.summary: Upgrading JIRA Manually Instructions update suggestions

*Actual Behavior*
JIRA fails to syncronize due to missing group attributes, and throws the following error:

{noformat}
2015-05-21 10:57:04,939 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-2 ERROR      [com.atlassian.scheduler.JobRunnerResponse] Unable to synchronise directory
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.OperationFailedException: Failed to synchronize directory group attributes for missing group: RDS Remote Access Servers
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.AbstractCacheRefresher.synchroniseAllGroupAttributes(AbstractCacheRefresher.java:129)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.AbstractCacheRefresher.synchroniseAll(AbstractCacheRefresher.java:94)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.UsnChangedCacheRefresher.synchroniseAll(UsnChangedCacheRefresher.java:168)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.synchroniseCache(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:1122)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectorySynchroniserImpl.synchronise(DirectorySynchroniserImpl.java:76)
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.JiraDirectorySynchroniser.synchronizeDirectory(JiraDirectorySynchroniser.java:96)
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.JiraDirectorySynchroniser.runJob(JiraDirectorySynchroniser.java:60)

*Steps to Reproduce*
- Set up an Active Directory Server 
- Create an AD Group that has more than 255 characters in the description
- Create a LDAP connector with minimal settings (no filters or anything like that)

*Environment*:

*Workaround*
* Exclude the following groups from directory synchronization through a [Group Object Filter|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Connecting+to+an+LDAP+Directory#ConnectingtoanLDAPDirectory-GroupSchemaSettings].
{quote}*RDS Endpoint Servers, Exchange Trusted Subsystem, RDS Remote Access Servers, RDS Management Servers, Help Desk*{quote} You can use the following filter for this.
{noformat}(&(objectClass=group)(!(cn=*RDS Endpoint Servers*))(!(cn=*Exchange Trusted Subsystem*))(!(cn=*RDS Remote Access Servers*))(!(cn=*RDS Management Servers*))(!(cn=*Help Desk*))){noformat}
* Also, it depends on which missing groups are showing in the logs. You can refer the steps below to check the missing groups:
*# Search for this *"Failed to synchronize directory group attributes for missing group"* exception in the logs (atlassian-jira.log)
*# You will see something like this:{code}Failed to synchronize directory group attributes for missing group: FC Financial Practitioners Observations{code}
(i) *FC Financial Practitioners Observations* is the missing group.
*# Re-amend the group object filter like: {code}(&(objectClass=group)(!(cn=*FC Financial Practitioners Observations*))){code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43494].
  {panel}

(This is a suggestion for the JIRA dev teams.)

From an operations point of view, if a process is not logging anything, it may be broken. 
So if a long running JIRA upgrade doesn't emit a message for more than 30s or so, then JIRA administrators may well think that the upgrade has failed. I've been seeing upgrades that just go silent for minutes at a time, and it makes them harder than necessary

As a suggested guideline, any upgrade task that has a loop in it should do the following:

1.  Log a message that the task is about to start processing and also log the number of items to process
2.. Log a message every 1% or 5% of items that are completed, aiming for a message every 30s or so
3.  Log a message when the task is completed with the number of items and total duration (this seems to be done already in most upgrade tasks)

#2 would be a big improvement for all JIRA upgrades

This came up in the context of JRA-34394 and a 6.2.7 to 6.4.4 upgrade
fields.summary: Upgrade tasks  - code review suggestion

fields.description:
Use case:

A customer asked me which version of Java to use with JIRA 6.4.4. I said the only way to know what Atlassian was using was to run the Linux or Windows installer. They asked me to find out without running the installer (https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/15833150/how-to-find-the-jre-version-in-the-jira-installer) but I was not able to.

The documentation currently just says use a version >= Java 1.8.0_40
But the exact version that is shipped with the JIRA installer is not documented anywhere

Suggestion: add the JVM version README,txt file that is already shipped with the JIRA server tar.gz packages. It looks like the JIRA version is already added there by the JIRA build/release process
fields.summary: Document the JRE version used with JIRA

Currently JIRA doesn't provide functionality for copying value from one field and its contents to another. Especially *system field* such as components , issue type , etc. Please provide the ability to do so in product.

h3. Workaround

# export your issue to excel : https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Exporting+Search+Results+to+Microsoft+Excel
# modify the value in excel
# import back your excel to JIRA by converting it to CSV : https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Importing+Data+from+CSV
fields.summary: Add the ability to copy system field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing the workflow, any Events in the workflow will use the System Language, regardless of what is used for the User Language

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# With System and User language set to English, create a new project and navigate to that workflows *Create* transition to view its post functions
!English.png|thumbnail!
# Change the system language to use a different language (eg. German)
# Change your profile language to use English
# Check the page Post Function page in Step 1

h3. Expected Results
# The screenshot should be exactly the same. Everything should be in English

h3. Actual Results
# Most of the page is in English, but the event is in German
!german.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
Tested with the following languages
|| System Lang || User Lang ||
| German | English |
| German | Chinese |
| German | Spanish |
| English | German |
| English | Chinese |
fields.summary: Workflow post function Event uses System Language instead of User Profile Language

fields.description:
*Summary*
If a user creates a custom field of type text(multi-line and uses wiki renderer) and add in a table to this field, it renders correctly when a user previews the issue in issue creation however once the user creates the issue and goes to view screen, the form is broken. If the field is viewed within a filter result gadget, it renders correctly.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Creates a custom field of type text(multi-line and uses wiki renderer)
# Add it to a screen
# When on the screen, add a table to the field created in step 1
# Click preview and you should see it render correctly
# View it on the view issue screen and it should be broken.
# Create a filter for searching for issue.
# Add the filter to a filter result gadget and add the field with the table.

*Expected Behaviour*
Table should be rendered correctly when viewed on the view issue screen.

*Actual Result*
Table is rendered incorrectly(appears correctly if you preview the column but should you save appears as a single line without the demarcators)
fields.summary: Multi Line Text Field fails to render tables in View Issue Screen

fields.description:
*Summary*
If a user creates a custom field of type text(multi-line and uses wiki renderer) and add in a table to this field, it shows correctly within issue creation however when they add this field to filter result gadget, the demarcators between the tables columns and rows are not rendered.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Creates a custom field of type text(multi-line and uses wiki renderer)
# Add it to a screen
# When on the screen, add a table to the field created in step 1
# Create a filter for searching for issue.
# Add the filter to a filter result gadget and add the field with the table.

*Expected Behaviour*
Table would be rendered correctly in the filter as seen when viewing in issue view.

*Actual Result*
Table is rendered without the demarcators in the filter though it's content still show.
fields.summary: Filter Result Does not show the Table demarcators if a field contains a Table

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43483].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, it's not possible to attach a file to JIRA when the file name contains restricted characters: {{'\', '/','\"', '%', ':', '$', '?', '*'}} (as per the documentation: [Attaching a File|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Attaching+a+File#AttachingaFile-AttachingaFiletoanIssue]). When a user attempts to upload a file with an incorrect name, they get an error message, then need to cancel the operation, get back to the file system, rename the file, get back to JIRA and attach it again. This can lead to a lot wasted time, especially when files are created and named automatically, e.g. in case of screenshots in Ubuntu.

h3. Suggested Solution
There should be an option to automatically sanitize the file name by removing the offending characters, and proceed with attaching the file right away.
fields.summary: Automatically Remove Special Characters From Attachment Filenames

h3. Problem Definition
When trying to view issues in "List View" mode, if there is too many fields in JIRA (including custom field) there is "x more option. Continue typing to refine further." as shown in the screenshot below:

Note the difference between .png and .jpg for JIRA logo

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43480].
  {panel}

On a JIRA where the "Date/Time Formats" are customised, a csv import with DateTime fields with a format different from the default "dd/MMM/yy h:mm a" fail to import fields with a message:
{quote}
(!) Cannot add value [ 11/03/15 10:27 ] to CustomField Test Date in Issue with summary 'Test Issue for DateTime CSV import'. Exception Message: Invalid date format. Please enter the date in the format "dd/MMM/yy h:mm a".
{quote}

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Go to the "Look and Feel" section and set "Complete Date/Time Format" to: *dd/MM/yy HH:mm*
# Create a Custom Field called "Test Date" and type "Date Time Picker" (no need to link it to a screen)
# Go to "External System Import" -> "Import from Comma-separated values (CSV)"
# Select the CSV file attached to this issue [^DateTimeTest.csv] and click Next
# Select a Project and verify the "Date format" is set to *dd/MM/yy HH:mm*
# Map to corresponding fields
# Click Next and Begin Import

*Expected Result:* Issue with DateTime field imports correctly
*Actual Result:* the issue is imported successfully but the "Date Time" fields is not and the error is displayed.

JIRA logs the following error:
{noformat}
2015-05-21 16:10:38,088 JiraTaskExectionThread-7 WARN mbadii 970x2777x1 503sx 59.167.133.1,59.167.29.201 /secure/admin/ImporterLogsPage!import.jspa [imports.importer.impl.AbstractDataImporter$1Thread[TP-Processor68,5,main]] Cannot add value [ 11/03/15 10:27 ] to CustomField Test Date in Issue with summary 'Test Issue for DateTime CSV import'. Exception Message: Invalid date format. Please enter the date in the format "dd/MMM/yy h:mm a".
com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.FieldValidationException: Invalid date format. Please enter the date in the format "dd/MMM/yy h:mm a".
      at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.DateTimeCFType.getSingularObjectFromString(DateTimeCFType.java:139)
      at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.DateTimeCFType.getSingularObjectFromString(DateTimeCFType.java:56)
      at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.AbstractSingleFieldType.getValueFromCustomFieldParams(AbstractSingleFieldType.java:230)
      at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.customfields.CustomFieldValueFactory.prepareValueForCustomField(CustomFieldValueFactory.java:55)
      at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.customfields.CustomFieldsUtil.setCustomFieldValueForIssue(CustomFieldsUtil.java:188)
      at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.importExternalCustomFields(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:1248)
      at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.createIssue(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:899)
      at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.importIssues(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:775)
      at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.doImport(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:401)
      at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ImporterCallable.call(ImporterCallable.java:26)
      at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ImporterCallable.call(ImporterCallable.java:15)
      at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:528)
      at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:491)
      at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
      at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
      at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
      at com.atlassian.jira.task.ForkedThreadExecutor$ForkedRunnableDecorator.run(ForkedThreadExecutor.java:254)
      at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}

*Note:*
* The problem doesn't occur when importing the custom date on the CSV into the default "Created Date" or "Resolution Date" fields.
* The error also happens if using a saved configuration .txt instead of manually setting the date.

*Workaround:*
* On the "Look and Feel" configuration section, revert "Complete Date/Time Format" settings before importing. It can be set back again after the import completes.
fields.summary: Invalid date format error when importing CSV DateTime fields with custom date format

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43479].
  {panel}

h3. *Summary*
Clicking on "Watchers" number icon to add watchers is not giving an option to add watchers. Instead the list moved upwards and the "Add Watchers" option is cropped.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Create an issue. (Make sure you have at least 40 users in your JIRA)
# Add all the users as "Watcher" for the issue.
# Click on the "Watchers" number icon to view all the watchers.

h3. *Expected Results*
!wacther_normal.png|thumbnail!
"Add Watchers" option *is visible*.

h3. *Actual Results*
!wacther_no_add_watchers.png|thumbnail!
"Add Watchers" option *is not visible*.

h3. *Note*
Problem is not browser related.

h3. *Workaround*
Use the *More* > *Add Watchers* option to add watchers to an issue.
fields.summary: Watcher List is shown upwards and "Add Watchers" option is not available

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43471].
  {panel}

*Summary*
Could not close tickets as the user didn't have the transition issue permission.
Didn't also get any notification from the Permission Helper nor Workflow to show that he lacked a specific permission.

Would appreciate if interdependent permissions are checked when a user runs permission helper that shows a warning that they do not have a dependent permission to achieve the permission they are verifying.

*Steps to Reproduce*
- Remove a user from transition permission in JIRA.
-* Ensure the user has Close Issue Permission.
- Attempt to close issue which the user has permission for.
-* Result: You would not have the close button hence cannot close the issue*
- Checking the Close Issue permission with permission helper would show that you have the needed permission to close the issue without showing that the dependent transition issue permission is missing which can be misleading.

*Moving Forward*
- Add a check to all dependent permissions that shows that a user does not have a permission to do a specific action because they are lacking the dependent permission and then return a warning to the customer telling them they lack that permission.
fields.summary: Allow Permission Helper show missing dependent Permissions
Our users would like to be able to  co-own a dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43469].
  {panel}

h3. Symptoms

When using the [Database Integrity Checker|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+Database+Integrity+Checker] a stack trace is generated.

The following may be found within the {{atlassian-jira.log}}:

{noformat:borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}

com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.integrity.exception.IntegrityException: Error occurred while performing check.
	at com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.integrity.check.WorkflowCurrentStepCheck.doCheck(WorkflowCurrentStepCheck.java:167)
	at com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.integrity.check.WorkflowCurrentStepCheck.preview(WorkflowCurrentStepCheck.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.integrity.IntegrityChecker.preview(IntegrityChecker.java:63)
	at com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.integrity.IntegrityChecker.previewWithIds(IntegrityChecker.java:35)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.IntegrityChecker.doExecute(IntegrityChecker.java:71)
	...
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.DefaultWorkflowSchemeManager.getSchemeForProject(DefaultWorkflowSchemeManager.java:382)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.DefaultWorkflowSchemeManager.getWorkflowName(DefaultWorkflowSchemeManager.java:350)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.getWorkflowName(OSWorkflowManager.java:166)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.getWorkflow(OSWorkflowManager.java:554)
	at com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.integrity.check.WorkflowCurrentStepCheck.doCheck(WorkflowCurrentStepCheck.java:111)
	...

{noformat}
h3. Cause

This is caused by an issue row in the {{jiraissue}} table that referred to a project id for a Project that no longer exists in the database. 

h3. Workaround

# Run the "Check Issue for Relation 'RelatedOSWorkflowEntry'" check first;
# Fix any entries that are returned;
# At this point the complete test can be run.
fields.summary: Integrity Checker throws exception when running complete test

*Summary*
I have a customer who would like to forward emails from one mail server to their JIRA incoming mail server.
He then wants the email to be created as an issue however the reporter would have to be the original sender of the email.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Send an Email to User A as User B in his personal Email.
# Send an Email to JIRA Server as User A.

*Current Behaviour*
JIRA creates an issue with reporter being USER A.

*Wanted Behaviour*
JIRA should make reporter B the reporter of the issue instead of User A.

Thanks.

Ismael
fields.summary: Create Issue and set reporter as original sender in a forwarded email

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43467].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Ideally JIRA doesn't make it possible when configuring screens to add fields to a tab, if that field has already been added to another tab on the same screen. However, it appears that in some rare case of database integrity issue, where a field occurs in more than one tab of the same screen, JIRA is unable to detect this situation or correct it automatically.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have some integrity check in JIRA to detect fields occurring in more than one tab.
fields.summary: Integrity Check for fields duplicated on tabs of the same screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43462].
  {panel}

The following suggestion is provide for your/my amusement, I don't seriously think it will get through but if it does it would be sweet.

The new feature is to have some kind of scoring system for users, where performing some action allocates points to the user.

e.g. 
- closing an issue within x days = +1 point 
- logging an issue that has already been solved in another JIRA ticket = -5000 points
- logging an issue that has already been answered in a confluence page = -5000 points
- logging an incomplete issue = -50000 points
- logging an issue as urgent, then when feedback is requested, take x days to respond = -500000 points
- logging an issue as urgent, then when it is fixed, take x days to test it = -5000000 points
- emailing JIRA without removing your signature, thereby adding a thousand attachments I have to then remove for you = -500000000000000 points

You could use this point system to allow you rank /  prioritize issues that are reported 
e.g. Bob has 500 points, Sue has -5000 points, Bobs issue gets looked at before Sue's

You could put a flag on the users avatar based on their points level

Points could unlock certain cool features e.g. animated GIF avatars

I'm sure others can think of ways to expand on this...
fields.summary: User ranking / scoring system

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43461].
  {panel}

During an upgrade the task: 'Performing Upgrade Task: JRA-34394: Fixing incorrect watch count for cloned issues' caused a re-index error for issues where watchers were added during creation of the issue (using the [JIRA Watcher Field Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.burningcode.jira.issue.customfields.impl.jira-watcher-field])

The work-around to fix this was to delete the plugin prior to performing the installation.

I'm not sure exactly why this was occurring, but it seemed to be related to this plugin.  

Upgraded from 6.3.11 to 6.4.4
fields.summary: Similar issue to super-task

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43458].
  {panel}

Hi,
I have a suggestion for filters within JIRA.  If your filter returns a number of pages i.e. more than 5 pages, you have to click each page number or use the arrows to move between pages. It would be nice if we could have a facility to allow direct navigation to the first page or last page i.e. << & >> as well as the < & > that already exist. For example, within the screenshot provided, there are a total of 8 pages.  If I am on Page 5, I have to first click on Page 3 to be able to get to Page 1 more quickly. I would like to be able to navigate directly from page 5 to either Page 8 or Page 1 and I can't currently do this.
Kind regards,
Melanie Cull
fields.summary: Multiple pages on filters do not allow navigation directly to first and last pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43453].
  {panel}

When commenting an issue, we are able to paste an attachments using a shortcut (for example, ctrl + c) and the attachment is automatically added as an attachment.

However, this option is not currently available when creating an issue. When pasting a file to the description field on creating an issue, the filename is pasted, rather than the file attached.

The video below shows the different between pasting to a comment and pasting when creating the issue:
!recording_attach.mp4!

As a user, when adding a description as I create an issue, if I have previously copied or cut a file, when pasting it, I'd like to have the file attached to the issue, rather than its name pasted in the field.
fields.summary: Allow pasting attachments when creating issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43451].
  {panel}

h4. Problem Definition

Currently any user with browse users permission is able to mention any user in an issue or comment. 

For use-cases where admins may not want members of a particular project to be able to see users restricted to another project (e.g. project a for customer a, and project b for customer b), it may be useful to limit user suggestions when using the @mention to mention users in comments or issues to users having browse project permissions.

h4. Suggested Solution

When the @ mention is used in a JIRA issue, it should have a browse projects permission check to limit suggested users to only users who have permissions to view the project.
fields.summary: Limit suggestions when using @ mentions to users who have relevant project permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43450].
  {panel}

h5. Summary:
If a user has set reporter to receive notification for when issues are created and when issues are commented(so they can get notification when others comment on their issues). If they set "Don't notify Me" in their {{profile > preference> My Changes}}.
They do not get any notification at all of changes they make, including a notification if they create an issue.
If they Set the option to "Notify Me", they get all updates of changes including those from their own comments.

We would like a feature that allows users to receive updates when they create an issue, however it would not notify them of their own comments.
fields.summary: Allow Reporter to get notification of Issues they create but not comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43448].
  {panel}

Given that during a transition, users dynamically upload attachments, and then type a comment, what results is a 'spread' of attachment creation times, potentially many minutes apart, making identification of them difficult as being 'related' the user action / transition that resulted in an IssueEvent.

So, with a user uploading the odd file, having a coffee, and thinking long and hard about the related comment, the Event Listener has no real idea of what attachments were stored as part of that transition. It would be reasonable (I thought) to assume that any attachment added within the last N seconds to the corresponding issue would be related to the current event, however, given the spread above, its not possible to 'tightly' identify by attachment creation time, which were created 'most likely' by the current event.

Is there a reason that the attachment creation timestamp reflects the point at which they were uploaded, rather than when the user hits submit on the transition screen?

Ideally, all attachments uploaded would have the same timestamp of the point at which the transition screen Submit occurred?

Alternatively, it would be super-useful for the transition related variables to be available in issue events, which they currently aren't.
fields.summary: When attachments are uploaded as part of a transition they get the upload timestamp as their creation date

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Transition a ticket changing the assignee of the ticket and also leaving a required field empty. The screen will prompt for the user to fill in the required field. When value is entered in the field and the transition is made, the assignee field will not be updated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 6.4.4 and create the first admin account
{code}Username: admin
Full Name: Administrator{code}
# Create a new user and add the user to the jira-administrator, jira-developers and jira-users group
{code}Username: user1
Full Name: First User{code}
# Create a new *Simple Issue Tracking* project (Eg. PROA)
# Create a new Screen (Eg. PROA: Reopen Issue Screen) and add the Assignee and Summary field to this screen
# Edit the workflow used by PROA (Eg. PROA: Simple Issue Tracking Workflow)
# Edit the *Reopen* Transition to use the newly created screen and publish the Workflow
# Create a new issue (Eg. PROA-1)
# Assign the issue to yourself (admin) and transition the issue to *Done*
!1.png|thumbnail!
# Click the *Reopen* transition, change the assignee to user1 (notice the assignee field automatically changes to the Full Name eg. First User), remove the summary, and click *Reopen*
!2.png|thumbnail!
# The screen will remain open prompting *You must specify a summary of the issue*. Notice the Assignee field changes to the username at this point eg. user1
!3.png|thumbnail!
# Enter the summary of the ticket and click *Reopen*. (At this point, assignee field remains as username, not Full Name)
[^Recording1.ogv] shows the steps in video format

h3. Expected Results
# The Assignee should be changed to *user1*

h3. Actual Results
# The Assignee remains as *administrator*
 
h3. Notes
*The problem is reproducible over again by the following steps*
# Click on *Done* transition and repeat steps 9-11 above again

*The problem will stop happening for this user once you perform the following (only if the Assignee field is the top field on the screen)*
# Assume the issue is just reopened
# Transition the issue do *Done*
# Click the *Reopen* transition, change the assignee to user1 (notice the assignee field automatically changes to the Full Name eg. First User), remove the summary, and click *Reopen*
# *IMPORTANT STEP DIFFERENT FROM ABOVE*
The screen will remain open prompting *You must specify a summary of the issue*. Click on the Assignee field and select user1 and also enter a summary. Notice the assignee field automatically changes to the Full Name
# Enter the summary of the ticket and click *Reopen*
# The assignee field will be updated accordingly
# Now, try to reproduce the problem by first assigning the issue back to yourself and clicking on the Done transition
# Click the *Reopen* transition, change the assignee to user1 (notice the assignee field automatically changes to the Full Name eg. First User), remove the summary, and click *Reopen*
# The screen will remain open prompting *You must specify a summary of the issue*. This time, if you click on the tab keyboard button or directly click on the Summary field, the assignee field will automatically change to the full name (eg. First User) and you can no longer reproduce the problem for this user

[^Recording2.ogv] shows the steps in video format

*If the Assignee field is not the top field, then the Bug is always reproducible*

h3. Additional
# If you now try to perform this step for this issue to another user (eg. user2), you will run into the problem again
# If you create a new issue (eg. PROA-2), user1 will be affected by this again
# This is browser independent. It happens on both Firefox and Chrome (did not test with IE). If you "fix" the problem in Firefox, Chrome will be "fixed" as well

h3. Workaround
Explicitly click on the Assignee field and make sure it changes to the *Full Name* before you perform the transition
fields.summary: Assignee field not updated when required field is empty
